page.title: 20AILSWORTH VILLAGE LIFE
page.content: Ailsworth is a well established village with a long history. One family, still resident in the village, has lived there since it was granted one and a half acres of land five hundred years age. The village has its own shops, pubs and a methodist chapel and a mobile library which visits weekly. Many other village services and amenities are available in the adjoining village of Castor. These include police, primary school, church and more shops and pubs. The village has a lively community which provides many events, services and amentites for the local people. These include a playgroup and a team of volunteers who welcome new families to the village, help families where someone is ill and provide assistance to older residents.
